title: cast command failing: GLIBC_2.33 / 32 / 34 not found
body:
### Component

Cast, Foundryup

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

foundryup --version nightly-35b6c011678ed8b7563819de095a9a68600a9752

### What command(s) is the bug in?

cast rpc --rpc_url http://<my anvil endpoint> eth_getBalance <my wallet> "latest"

### Operating System

Linux ARM

### Describe the bug


![image](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/assets/46257136/9e4ca742-f3de-4f0e-bf12-3d12a0d7cd29)


The above error happened inside of our BuildJet CICD runner which consists of a docker-compose cluster:
- Integration tests are run from a Linux x86 Docker container which call the above `cast` command.
- The BuildJet runner is in ARM, so the container calling `cast` is emulating x86 via QEMU 

Switching back to `nightly-ec3f9bd42795c9b2238b5f4c9f51997b22cc9e27` fixed this, but ideally would like to just point my GitHub scripts at a stable "nightly" version.

Tried to just use `foundryup --version nightly`, but the current July 11 Nightly version throws this error on install:

```
foundryup: installing foundry (version nightly, tag nightly-554b7b3a73422641e56fad35fa1ed62e786b2f51)
foundryup: downloading latest forge, cast, anvil, and chisel
############################################################################################################## 100.0%
tar: Error opening archive: Unrecognized archive format
foundryup: command failed: tar -xzC /Users/<my_laptop>/.foundry/bin
foundryup: downloading manpages
############################################################################################################## 100.0%
tar: Error opening archive: Unrecognized archive format
foundryup: installed - forge 0.2.0 (35b6c01 2023-09-25T18:05:31.308398000Z)
foundryup: installed - cast 0.2.0 (35b6c01 2023-09-25T18:05:31.054019000Z)
foundryup: installed - anvil 0.2.0 (35b6c01 2023-09-25T18:05:31.181548000Z)
foundryup: installed - chisel 0.2.0 (35b6c01 2023-09-25T18:05:30.927640000Z)
foundryup: done!
```

üôè
We also have this, when doing `foundryup` inside a `rust:1.70` docker image. Worked fine yesterday. Same inside `rust:1.71.1`.
